elements.title: Calamophyton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that trees of the extinct genus Calamophyton (example pictured) formed the earliest known forest?

elements.title: Pavel Chioru (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Soviet politician Pavel Chioru wanted "Moldovan", which he developed from a dialect of Romanian, to serve as a language of the "exploited" against the supposedly upper-class Romanian?

elements.title: KOKO Networks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that KOKO Networks has used more than $100 million in carbon financing to subsidise cooking fuels in Kenya?

elements.title: competed in an international competition (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first time the New England Revolution competed in an international competition, they played their "home" match at their opponent's stadium?

elements.title: The Lyricist Wannabe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 drama film The Lyricist Wannabe is the first motion picture about Cantopop lyric writing?

elements.title: Clint Sargent (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Clint Sargent succeeded Scott Nagy as head coach of the Wright State Raiders, years after he played for him with the South Dakota State Jackrabbits?

elements.title: Connecting Humanity (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Palestinian journalist Hind Khoudary was one of the first two people in the Gaza Strip to receive donated eSIMs through the initiative Connecting Humanity?

elements.title: William Lambdin Prather (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Lambdin Prather introduced the phrase "the eyes of Texas are upon you", which was incorporated into the school song of the University of Texas at Austin?

elements.title: a Buffy the Vampire Slayer episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Buffy the Vampire Slayer episode features a body-swap storyline that academics compared to a thought experiment from Plato's Republic?
